name: coding_style.vim
description: If you have many projects with different coding styles (indent settings), then use this plug-in
install_details:
1. Create `~/.coding_style.ini' (default value of `g:coding_style_ini') with format: 
[filetype] 
name1 = path1 # comment 
name2 = path2 

`name1' and `name2' are common indent files. 
`path1' and `path2' are your paths of projects. 

2. Create `~/.vim/coding_styles/name1.vim', `~/.vim/coding_styles/name2.vim' and etc.
`~/.vim/coding_styles' is default value of `g:coding_style_dir'.

Now, you can choose coding style by file path :-) 

For example: 
[cpp] 
defaultcpp = /home/pitman/ 
googlecpp = /home/pitman/work/project1 

[c] 
linuxstyle = /home/pitman/work/kernels/ 
gnustyle = /home/pitman/work/hurd 

And create indent files (`defaultcpp.vim', `googlecpp.vim' and etc) into `~/.vim/coding_styles/'. 

NB: disable `filetype indent'. See `:help filetype'. 

NB2: You can use more informative status line: 
set statusline=%<%f%h%m%r%=style=%{CodingStyle()}\ %15(L%l,C%c%V%)\ %3P

versions.release_notes: Added support of comments in the g:coding_style_ini file.

Renamed the folder cs_indent to coding_styles.
Removed styles.txt.
Added g:coding_style_ini (default ~/.coding_style.ini).
Added g:coding_style_dir (default ~/.vim/coding_styles).
Added CodingStyle() for checking of current coding style.
